instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3023: What is 820-3023? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a fans spinning fast
threads.message:
had minor corrossion on few chips, now it turns on, but takes too long to boot, fans are spinning fast and its lagging.
hwmonitor says:
cpu core 2, 3 = 128c
cpu proximity 35c
peci sa 128c
peci gpu 128c
cpu core 1 128c

whar sensors are responsible for core tempratures? i can't find asd for this model, so i am stuck and don't know where to start

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a fans spinning fast
threads.message:
Got hold of asd, it shows

sensor pcpt, tc0c, tc1c are failed

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a fans spinning fast
threads.message:
Take a look at <CHIP>U5510</CHIP> area.
Check all its traces, solders and resistors around.
Be sure to have good continuity to all sensors, <TRANSISTOR>Q5510</TRANSISTOR>-40.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a fans spinning fast
threads.message: checked them and they are fine, even reballed the smc, but still same thing

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a fans spinning fast
threads.message:
Post complete messages for ASD errors.
Should be 3-4 text lines for each error.

Be sure <SIGNAL>SMC_AVREF</SIGNAL> voltage is correct.
